posts.author: eatU4myT
posts.content:
Whilst R/F/CoT is hardly a novel class combination, I've never seen one that wasn't built towards a specific goal, either Devestating Critical, Epic Damage Reduction etc. My main reason for enjoying this class combo is how reliable and easy it is to play. So:


Classes: Rogue (12), Fighter (4), Champion of Torm (24)
Race: Dwarf
Alignment: Any Non-Evil (Usually Chaotic Good)


I Stats:

Str 16 (30)
Dex 12 (12)
Con 16 (18)
Wis 12 (12)
Int 14 (14)
Dex 6 (6)


II Level Progression:

01 R1 Strong Soul
02 F1 Expertise
03 R2 Iron Will
04 F2 Weapon Proficiency (Exotic), +1 Con
05 R3
06 F3 Weapon Focus (?)
07 R4
08 F4 Weapon Specialisation (?), +1 Con
09 R5 Toughness
10 CoT1
11 R6
12 CoT2 Power Attack, Cleave, +1 Str
13 R7
14 CoT3
15 R8 Blind Fight
16 CoT4 Knockdown, +1 Str
17 R9
18 CoT5 Improved Knockdown
19 R10 Crippling Strike
20 CoT6 Improved Expertise, +1 Str
21 CoT7 Epic Will
22 CoT8 Epic Weapon Focus (?)
23 CoT9
24 CoT10 Great Strength I, Epic Weapon Specialisation (?), +1 Str
25 R11
26 CoT11
27 CoT12 Great Strength II
28 CoT13 +1 Str
29 CoT14 Armour Skin
30 CoT15 Great Strength III
31 CoT16
32 CoT17 +1 Str
33 CoT18 Great Strength IV, Epic Prowess
34 CoT19
35 CoT20
36 CoT21 Great Strength V, +1 Str
37 CoT22 Epic Fortitude
38 R12
39 CoT23 Great Strength VI
40 CoT24 +1 Str


III Vitals:

Saving Throws (F/R/W): 43/36/36 (vs Spell: 47/40/40)
Hitpoints: 552
AC: 13 (with mundane full plate & large shield: 25)
BAB: 27
AB: 38/33/28/23 (with one mundane weapon of choice: 41/36/31/36)


IV Skills:

Skillpoints: 262 (modified score)

Appraise 16 (18)
Disable Traps 14 (16)
Discipline 43 (53)
Heal 39 (40)
Lore 22 (26)
Open 19 (20)
Persuade 20 (18)
Search 21 (23)
Spellcraft 16 (10) - Cross Class
Tumble 25 (16)
Use Magic Item 27 (25)

(Skills chosen very much for playability/roleplay reasons. 170 of the 262 skill points are gained by level 20, allowing you to take your Rogue skills to decent levels straight away, before slowly increasing Discipline, Heal & Spellcraft.)



I play this character as a reliable, do everything, no specific strength but no specific weakness type character, with a heavy emphasis on being playable all the way up, 1 - 40.

He can use any weapon in the game, and can choose any one weapon to take the Focus/Specialistaion feats to gain +3 to hit, +6 damage. The choice can be based on player preference, or situational (Dwarven Waraxe for the look, Morningstar for vs Undead etc.)

He has the three main combat techniques sorted. Expertise & Improved Expertise bring his AC in mundane armour up to 30 or 35, which combined with 552 hitpoints lets him tank pretty well. Improved Knockdown helps combat bosses, and opens them up to a sneak attack for +6D6 damage, +2 points of Str damage. Power Attack & Cleave let him chew through hordes quickly, consider switching in a 2-handed weapon here to gain the 1.5 x Str modifier.

His saves are strong, and balanced to avoid a weak spot. Fortitude is higher than the others - at 43, this covers him against Devestating Criticals from anyone with a modified Strength of less than about 40!

He can identify and use most items in the game up to a value of around 300,000, and can get a decent deal buying and selling them.
He can find and disable all non-epic traps, open most locks, and get his own way in many conversations.
He avoids attacks of opportunity and most knockdown and disarm attempts, gains some bonuses to saves vs spell, and makes good use of healing kits.

The racical bonuses for Dwarves suit the character well. All the skill bonuses are built upon, the Con bonus and Cha reduction fit, and the bonuse to saves vs spell help make up for the fact that Spellcraft is a cross-class skill.



I know there are improvements that could be made to this build to improve it at level 40. It is, for example, silly to take R12/CoT24, when R14/CoT22 would gain you Uncanny Dodge III, +1D6 sneak damage and an additional rogue bonus feat, all for the cost of -1 to saving throws. However, the only place I can ever get these to fit in without changing the playability of the character is at levels 39 and 40, by which time it seems a bit late to be bothering. But, for someone playing PvP or just at level 40, that would be an obvious step.

There will also be changes that could be made in the skills selection to suit power gaming. You can dump Appraise & Persuade to increase Tumble to 40 for the +3AC, and pump some more cross-class points into Spellcraft for another +2 saves vs spells.



My question to you would probably be, does the character suffer too much from Jack-of-all-Trades syndrome? In taking a little of everything, have I left him with not enough of anything?

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey, man. Welcome to the ECB.

This build is, I must say, far from optimized. There are many improvements you could make to make it MUCH better, both in terms of level 40 power and playability. However, you must understand how certain skills work. Spellcraft, Tumble and UMD work up in increments of 5, which takes away the whole purpose of taking more than 4 Rogue levels pre-epic, which hurts your BAB. That same character could have +2 AB JUST FOR changing the pre-epic spread. Now, with that many Fighter and CoT levels, feats seem almost unnecessary, BUT you can go for many tweaks to improve this build. Here's what I'd do:

1- I'd change the FULL SPREAD to Fighter 6 / Rogue 16 / CoT 18. You'd lose some saves and one CoT Bonus Feat, BUT, here's what you'd gain: MANY Skill points (do the math, but I think about 6 per added level of Rogue, so 24), 2d6 SA damage, 2 Rogue Bonus Feats, which you can take Crippling Strike and two Epic Skill Focus feats, which in turn will increase two of your skill modifiers by 10, allowing you to spread some other points around for more skill efficiency and more jack-of-all-tradeness. Or you can take Improved Evasion, which will go very well with your high saves.

2- I'd change the pre-epic spread to Fighter 6 CoT 10 Rogue 4 for a higher BAB.

3- I'd MAX Tumble for more AC. You get +1 to your AC for every 5 ranks in Tumble (BASE RANKS), so this is a no-brainer.

4- I'd also tweak the starting stats. You could easily drop your DEX down to 10 for Wisdom 14 and +1 to your Will Save (which is your lowest) without altering the concept of the build. I'd also drop Strong Soul for Luck of Heroes.

At first glance, this is what I can see. Later on I may take another look depending on your reply. I'd recommend you read my Complete Guide to the Basics of Character Building to understand how the pre-epic BAB progression works, if you don't already know, and if you do, then read it anyway, maybe there's something you'll learn or even something you can contribute from your own experience.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: eatU4myT
posts.content:
Thanks for the welcome! Some food for thought there definitely.

I can see the advantages of upping the rogue levels and dropping some CoT levels. However, for me, that would mean even more of an incentive to take more rogue levels pre-epic. I know where you are coming from - the less levels of the 3/4 BAB class you take pre-epic the better - but for me, that +2 BAB is not as important as being able to reach your target for all your rogue skills by about level 18. And the answer there isn't "just make sure you save one of the 4 rogue levels until then", which would certainly enable you to raise one of your skills to its target, but you wouldn't have banked enough skill points to get them all up there. Even Tumble, which for sure only helps later on in batches of 5, initially you are just racing towards a DC of 14, and picking it up 1 point at a time from the word go does help.

I guess I am saying that only taking 4 rogue levels pre-epic would, for me, hamper the playability of the build at that stage enough that I wouldn't see that as worth a +2 BAB. Really, in a build which only reaches an AB of 38/33/28/23, I would think that just having BAB at 16+ pre-epic for the final attack is good enough?

As for stats, you certainly could drop the Dex to 10. I guess that's just force of habit, associating Dex 12 with Full Plate! AC is hardly the highlight of this build, so dropping a point there wouldn't break anything.



As a complete aside from this build, is there an easy way to search these forums for builds by class?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You could split the difference, taking 8 Rogue pre-epic, gaining +1 AB instead of +2.

The Epic Character Build Search Engine does that for the archived old forums, but these forums have no such search engine. You could try the standard forum search button, but it would find all mentions of the classes, rather than only builds.
